alert.note: Alert for North Sioux; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 12:29PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .Widespread light rainfall expected today across the area with a few storms producing moderate to heavy rainfall at times this afternoon through late tonight. Recent heavy rainfall has locally saturated soils across the region. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Southeast Wyoming and the Nebraska Panhandle. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall from slow moving thunderstorms, and training thunderstorms, will create the potential for localized flash flooding across portions of southeast Wyoming and the Nebraska Panhandle. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
